results.title: The Roll press: a Hugh Smith shipyard machine tool
results.brief_description: Documentary explaining the significance of the roll press introduced by Hugh Smith in the early 1900s. Talks of the technical aspects of how it’s built plus its use and significance to the shipyard.

results.title: The Roll of drums
results.brief_description: A circus performer is trained to take calculated risks, he plans, practises and perfects the stunts, for which he gets paid. Often users of heavy machinery take risks which lead to serious accidents. When danger is at hand, the victim should hear a roll of drums and take evasive action.

results.title: The Role of the Coach
results.creator_credit: Bosisto Productions, South Australian Film Corporation, Bruce Moir and John Dick
results.brief_description: A training film to be used as a discussion starter in the development of new and practising coaches. Emphasises the aims of coaching, the different styles of coaching and individual reasons for involvement.

results.title: The Role of government
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and David Jackson
results.brief_description: Legislation is one of the ways by which tight control is kept on environmental matters relating to public health. Looks at the way such legislation arises, how it is drafted within a Government department and the political constraints on its implementation.

results.title: The Rocky horror picture show. - [Collector's ed.]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Michael White and Jim Sharman
results.brief_description: A cult classic, “The Rocky Horror Picture Show” has it all. A musical score by Richard O’Brien, who also stars as the butler Riff Raff, high energy dancing and excellent performances by Barry Bostwick and Susan Sarandon as preppie couple Brad and Janet; Tim Curry as Doctor Frank’n’furter, the ‘Sweet transvestite from transsexual Transylvania’, and a host of others. This collector’s edition celebrates the film’s 21st birthday and includes an hour of extra footage of deleted scenes, outtakes and the Rocky Horror phenomena.

results.title: The Rocket
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe, Rayant Pictures, Anthony Gilkison and William Pollard
results.brief_description: Illustrates the progress of the rocket from a Chinese firecracker, through various 17th century inspirations for space travel, to its applications today. Shows scenes of Britain’s rocket research establishments; points out the part played rockets in World War II., and describes some American post-war experiments in rocket development.

results.title: The Rock of love = Sakhrat al hub
results.creator_credit: Egyptian Film Company and Rida Myassar
results.brief_description: Karima and Aadel are both escaping painful pasts and guarded secrets in Egypt. They meet in Beirut, a city where they find peace and where they fall in love. But as always, the road to love is a thorny one and they must both come to terms with their fears. For Karima, it is being stalked - is it the detective who is constantly turning up wherever she goes, or some other darker stranger? And Aadel must come to terms with his fears after a loveless marriage which ended in him brutally murdering his wife - for which he was imprisoned for one year! Starring Samira Ahmad and Aamad Homdy. In Arabic with no English subtitles.

results.title: The Rock cycle
results.brief_description: Examines the rock cycle as a fundamental geologic process by which earth materials are formed and altered. Identifies the major types of rocks and describes how they are affected by erosion, weathering, heat and pressure.

results.title: The Rock
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and World Mirror
results.brief_description: A travelogue of Gibraltar. The atmosphere of cosmopolitan bustle in the busy streets and cafes; the holidaymakers on the sunlit beaches; the mixed uniforms of soldiers, sailors and airmen stationed at “Gib”; the famous Barbary Apes; the Ceremony of the Keys in the fortress.

results.title: The Robot moles
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company, Masaji Hara, Matsue Jimbo and Tadanori Okamoto
results.brief_description: Japanese animated puppet film. Hanako, a little girl who loves flowers, makes a drawing of a mechanical mole which would cultivate flowers. The scientists mistake it for an order to construct such a device, and build a team of robot moles.
